main_definition: To perform a surgical procedure or carry out an action with skill, effort, or intervention.

meanings_and_examples.example: The doctor will operate to remove the patient's gallbladder.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To function or work as intended after an intervention, repair, or adjustment.
meanings_and_examples.example: After replacing the faulty part, the machine operated smoothly again.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To control or manage something with authority and expertise.
meanings_and_examples.example: The project manager will operate the team to ensure everything runs on schedule.
